titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Daniel C. Jacobsen Photographs of Stanford Student Life
Jacobsen (Daniel C.) Photographs of Stanford Student Life
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Daniel C. Jacobsen photographs of Stanford student life
did.abstract: Photographs probably taken by David S. Jacobson, Stanford class of 1930. Images include designs for card stunts done by the cheering section at football games, ca. 1929; Zoology Club, 1927, with David Starr Jordan; students of the classes of 1928 and 1929, including Robert Wade King, James Ross Nichols, Leon Levi, and Major Bryant Godsol; group of male students on a road trip (many from the class of 1928); campus buildings, including Encina Commons, student union, boathouse, Mausoleum, and athletic buildings; the Angel of Grief; and a horse-drawn mower cutting grass on campus. There is also one photograph of Brawley Union High School, Brawley, CA (David Jacobson's home town).

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Daniel C. Jacobsen Photographs of Stanford Student Life (PC0070). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

altformavail.head: Alternative Formats
altformavail.p: The photographs have been digitized and are available online: http://purl.stanford.edu/mr076qw7472.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs probably taken by David S. Jacobson, Stanford class of 1930. Images include designs for card stunts done by the cheering section at football games, ca. 1929; Zoology Club, 1927, with David Starr Jordan; students of the classes of 1928 and 1929, including Robert Wade King, James Ross Nichols, Leon Levi, and Major Bryant Godsol; group of male students on a road trip (many from the class of 1928); campus buildings, including Encina Commons, student union, boathouse, Mausoleum, and athletic buildings; the Angel of Grief; and a horse-drawn mower cutting grass on campus. There is also one photograph of Brawley Union High School, Brawley, CA (David Jacobson's home town).
